entry.summary: Two important news stories, plus our thoughts on GNOMEâ€™s new windowing proposal and the Framework 16.

entry.title: 528: I'm a 1.2x Developer
entry.summary: Elon Musk trying to build the "everything app" is ridiculous, and the quiet little promise openAI just made with the White House.

entry.title: 520: To Infinity and Berlin
entry.summary: Do they build them better in Germany? We try out the next-generation InfinityBook Pro 14 and dig into TUXEDO OS.

entry.title: 527: The Internet is for Stealing JPGs
entry.summary: Shopify has a mind-blowingly obvious solution to too many meetings, a recent failure Chris is struggling with, and more.

entry.title: 519: The Clone Grift Wars
entry.summary: Have Oracle and SUSE lost their minds? Plus, we dig into Fedora's proposal to add telemetry collection to Workstation.

entry.title: 526: The Closing Moment of Opportunity
entry.summary: openAI's window to build their moat is closing, but they have a powerful friend stepping up to help seal the deal. Plus, our reaction to Oracle's very spicy response to Red Hat.

entry.title: 518: Race To Immutability
entry.summary: Can Ubuntu make a great immutable desktop? We're trying the brand-new "Everything is a Snap" Ubuntu Core Desktop.

entry.title: Linux Action News 299
entry.summary: Recent advances in embedded Linux, Canonical takes full control of LXD, ZFS gets a handy Btrfs feature, and updates on the show's production.

entry.title: 525: Mike Gets Unreal
entry.summary: Mike updates us on his development adventures in Unreal 5, signs the Vision Pro might be a flop, and answer questions about abandoning Red Hat's platform.
